results.title: Design for living
results.brief_description: Looks at the considerations involved in designing homes for different locations and the problems faced in ensuring their suitability for particular functions. results.title: Design for irrigation: reconstructure of the home farm. Pt 2
results.brief_description: Describes a plan for more efficient irrigation of an old property. The chief problem is poorly designed and maintained supply and distribution ditches. In some areas, trees are small and deformed through lack of water - in others flooding is so bad that neighbours complain of seepage. Suggests immediate plan requiring cleaning and modification of supply and drainage channels. The long term plan put forward suggests the use of concrete channels and underground pipelines, which would result in perfect water distribution and in this case, room for more trees in place of open channels.

A model of the block shows the contours, and the method of ploughing, irrigating and planting which should be carried out in relation to the contour lines.

results.title: Design for disaster
results.creator_credit: William Miller and Cinematography Unit, LA City Fire Department
results.brief_description: In 1959 brush fires in the Los Angeles forest area made fire officers describe the region as being a “design for disaster”. This film shows the fire in November 1961 which destroyed 250 homes, without loss of life. It explains its causes and tries to suggest possible remedies.

results.title: Design for climate
results.creator_credit: S.T. Evans, Building Research and Development Advisory Committee and Nicholas Alexander
results.brief_description: Research on problems of building design for Australian conditions. Maintaining an acceptable indoor climate by economic means involves a building of suitable thermal characteristics using insulation and heating and cooling as required, proper lighting and ventilation. The noise problem, protection of external surfaces and relating the building to its environment for best use of the natural climate are considered.

results.title: Design for assembly
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Barron, Peter Riding and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Approaching Automation”.
Discusses ways of increasing productivity by means of (1) design liaison with production engineers and sales personnel and, (2) low-cost automating techniques for small and medium batch assembly lines. Industrialists, engineers and consultants are interviewed to show the lessons that can be learned from their experiences.
